p: The compound 1 showed the strongest antibacterial effect against Shigella flexneri and Yersinia enterocolitica (MIC:1250 Î¼g/mL) (Figure 3). Compound 1 was found to be effective against all bacteria and yeast (Table 2). Antibacterial and antifungal activity were determined in 6 compounds (1, 2, 4, 6, 8 and 9).
